bibl.title: The Christian Remains inside the Temple of Dendara.
bibl.note: Paper presented in the First Annual Symposium of Coptic Studies held on 29 March 2008 at the University of Toronto. - Introduction. - The graffiti. [Crosses; - Boats; - Human figures; - Animal figures; - Floral and geometrical ornaments; - Coptic inscriptions; - Arabic inscriptions; - Notes on technical aspect]. - Other Christian remains in the temple of Dendara. - Other ancient egyptian temples in the Theban region with Christian remains. [Djimé inside the temple of Ramsses III at Medinet Habu; - The temple of Dayr al Medina in western Thebes; - The Ramesseum; - The monastery of saint Phoibamon in Day al Bahari; - Karnak in the Christian period]. - Early Christian literary sources about Dendara [The writings of Athanasius; - Coptic hagiography; - The martyrdom of Papnoute; - The martyrdom of Ptolemy; - The martyrdom of the 400 persons from the town of Dendara]. - Ancient egyptian feasts christianized in Dendara [The navigation festival of Het-hert in the month of Athyr (Hathur) (The navigation of the sacred boat); - The thanksgiving for the inundation; - The Epiphany of 11th of Tubah (Osiris feast)]. - Conclusion.
